00030 //       ~~~~~~~~~
00031 //  **** Functions :
00032 //       ~~~~~~~~~~~
00033 //               GetString  ( reads substring from a string         )
00034 //               GetStrTer  ( reads substring and put term-ing null )
00035 //               strcpy_n   ( copies not more than n characters     )
00036 //               strcpy_ns  ( like strcpy_ns and pads with spaces   )
00037 //               strcpy_n0  ( like strcpy_n and adds terminating 0  )
00038 //               PadSpaces  ( pads a string with spaces             )

00040 //  (C) E. Krissinel 2000-2013

00051 #define  UseDoubleFloat
00052 
00053 #ifndef __ClassMacros
00054 
00055 # define __ClassMacros
00056 
00057  //  A Class definition macros
00058 # define DefineClass(ClassName)             \
00059    class ClassName;                         \
00060    typedef ClassName    * P##ClassName;     \
00061    typedef ClassName    & R##ClassName;     \
00062    typedef P##ClassName * PP##ClassName;    \
00063    typedef P##ClassName & RP##ClassName;
00064 
00065  //  A Structure definition macros
00066 # define DefineStructure(StructureName)             \
00067    struct StructureName;                            \
00068    typedef StructureName    * P##StructureName;     \
00069    typedef StructureName    & R##StructureName;     \
00070    typedef P##StructureName * PP##StructureName;    \
00071    typedef P##StructureName & RP##StructureName;
00072 
00073 #endif
00074 
00075 #define UNUSED_ARGUMENT(x) (void)x
00076

00181   // ------------------------------------------------------------
00182 
00183   //  Initialization. Some C++ enviroments do not do call
00184   // InitMatType() automatically, therefore it is always
00185   // advisable to call InitMatType() explicitely from the top of
00186   // main(). It is completely harmless and cheap (although
00187   // unnecessary) to call InitMatType() multiple times.
00188   extern bool InitMatType();

00192   inline int mround ( realtype X )  { return  (int)floor(X+0.5);   }
00193   inline int ifloor ( realtype X )  { return  (int)floor(X);       }
00194   inline int Abs    ( int x )       { return ( x >= 0 ? x : -x );  }
00195 
00196   inline void ISwap ( int & x, int & y )
00197   { int  b = x;  x = y;  y = b; }
00198 
00199   inline void WSwap ( word & x, word & y )
00200   { word  b = x;  x = y;  y = b; }
00201 
00202   inline void BSwap ( byte & x, byte & y )
00203   { byte b = x;  x = y;  y = b; }
00204 
00205   inline void OSwap ( bool & x, bool & y )
00206   { bool b = x;  x = y;  y = b; }
00207 
00208   inline void LSwap ( long & x, long & y )
00209   { long b = x;  x = y;  y = b; }
00210 
00211   inline void RSwap ( realtype & x, realtype & y )
00212   { realtype b = x;  x = y;  y = b; }
00213 
00214   inline realtype RMax ( const realtype x1, const realtype x2 )
00215   { return ( x1 > x2 ? x1 : x2 );  }
00216 
00217   inline long LMax ( const long x1, const long x2 )
00218   { return ( x1 > x2 ? x1 : x2 );  }
00219 
00220   inline word WMax ( const word x1, const word x2 )
00221   { return ( x1 > x2 ? x1 : x2 );  }
00222 
00223   inline int IMax ( const int x1,  const int x2  )
00224   { return ( x1 > x2 ? x1 : x2 );  }
00225 
00226   inline realtype RMin ( const realtype x1, const realtype x2 )
00227   { return ( x1 < x2 ? x1 : x2 );  }
00228 
00229   inline long LMin ( const long x1, const long x2 )
00230   { return ( x1 < x2 ? x1 : x2 );  }
00231 
00232   inline word WMin ( const word x1, const word x2 )
00233   { return ( x1 < x2 ? x1 : x2 );  }
00234 
00235   inline int  IMin ( const int x1,  const int x2  )
00236   { return ( x1 < x2 ? x1 : x2 );  }
00237 
00238   inline realtype fsign ( const realtype x1,  const realtype x2 )  {
00239   realtype  ax;
00240     if (x1>=0.0)  ax = x1;
00241             else  ax = -x1;
00242     return ( x2 >= 0.0 ? ax : -ax );
00243   }

00246   // ------------------------------------------------------------
00247 
00248   //    Allocated vectors are enumerated as [Shift..Shift+N-1]
00249   //  rather than [0..N-1] !
00250   //    Get-functions return  <true>  if memory was allocated;
00251   //  if allocation attemt fails,  vector is assigned with  NULL
00252 
00253   extern bool GetVectorMemory ( rvector  & V, word N, word Shift=1 );
00254   extern bool GetVectorMemory ( ivector  & I, word N, word Shift=1 );
00255   extern bool GetVectorMemory ( wvector  & W, word N, word Shift=1 );
00256   extern bool GetVectorMemory ( bvector  & B, word N, word Shift=1 );
00257   extern bool GetVectorMemory ( ovector  & O, word N, word Shift=1 );
00258   extern bool GetVectorMemory ( lvector  & L, word N, word Shift=1 );
00259   extern bool GetVectorMemory ( lwvector & L, word N, word Shift=1 );
00260   extern bool GetVectorMemory ( psvector & P, word N, word Shift=1 );
00261 
00262   //    Shift at deallocation MUST be the same as that at allocation !
00263   //   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
00264   //    Free-functions do nothing if vector has value  NULL (e.g.
00265   //  after unsuccessful allocation).
00266 
00267   extern void FreeVectorMemory ( rvector  & V, word Shift=1 );
00268   extern void FreeVectorMemory ( ivector  & I, word Shift=1 );
00269   extern void FreeVectorMemory ( wvector  & W, word Shift=1 );
00270   extern void FreeVectorMemory ( bvector  & B, word Shift=1 );
00271   extern void FreeVectorMemory ( ovector  & O, word Shift=1 );
00272   extern void FreeVectorMemory ( lvector  & L, word Shift=1 );
00273   extern void FreeVectorMemory ( lwvector & L, word Shift=1 );
00274   extern void FreeVectorMemory ( psvector & P, word Shift=1 );

00278   //    Allocated matrices are enumerated as
00279   //          [ShiftN..ShiftN+N-1, ShiftM..ShiftM+M-1]
00280   //  rather than [0..N-1,0..M-1] !
00281   //    Get-functions return  <true>  if memory was allocated;
00282   //  if allocation attemt fails,  matrix is assigned with  NULL
00283   //    Free-functions do nothing if matrix has value  NULL (e.g.
00284   //  after unsuccessful allocation).
00285

00414   //   CreateCopy(..) allocates Dest string and copies the contents of
00415   // Source into it. If Dest is not NULL prior calling the function,
00416   // it is attempted to deallocate first.

00419   extern pstr CreateCopy_n   ( pstr & Dest, cpstr Source, int n );

00461   extern pstr UpperCase ( pstr s );
00462 
00463   //   GetString(..) copies first M characters of string S into string
00464   // L, appending the terminating null. If S contains less then M
00465   // characters, L will be padded with spaces.
00466   extern void GetString ( pstr L, cpstr S, int M );
00467 
00468   //   GetStrTer(..) copies at least n (or LMax if LMax<n) first symbols
00469   // of string S into string L, then continues copying until first space
00470   // or terminating null is found. If the terminating null is met among
00471   // the first n characters or if SMax<n, the string L will be padded
00472   // with spaces till the length of minimum of n and LMax and then
00473   // terminated with the null.
00474   //   LMax and SMax are the buffer lengths of L and S,
00475   // respectively. Even if no space is found, the last character
00476   // in L will be the terminating null.
00477   extern void GetStrTer ( pstr L, cpstr S, int n, int LMax,
00478                           int SMax );
00479 
00480 
00481   // Version of GetStrTer(..) allowing for spaces in the string.
00482   //
00483   //   Copies at least n (or LMax if LMax<n) first symbols of
00484   // string S into string L, then continues copying until first
00485   // terminating null is found. If the terminating null
00486   // is met among the first n characters or if SMax<n, the string
00487   // L will be padded with spaces till the length of minimum of
00488   // n and LMax and then terminated with the null.
00489   //   SMax are buffer lengths of L and S, respectively. The last
00490   // character in L will be the terminating null.
00491   extern void GetStrTerWin32File ( pstr L, cpstr S, int n,
00492                                    int LMax, int SMax );
00493 
00494 
00495   //   strcpy_n(..) copies at most n symbols from string s to d,
00496   // but no more than strlen(s) (s must contain a terminating
00497   // null). The terminating null IS NEITHER appended OR copied
00498   // to d.
00499   extern void strcpy_n  ( pstr d, cpstr s, int n );
00500 
00501   //   strcpy_n1(..) copies at most n last symbols from string s
00502   // to d, but no more than strlen(s) (s must contain a terminating
00503   // null). The string in d is aligned to the right and added with
00504   // spaces at the left, if necessary. The terminating null
00505   // IS NEITHER appended OR copied to d.
00506   extern void strcpy_n1 ( pstr d, cpstr s, int n );
00507 
00508   //   Copies at most n symbols from string s to d, but no
00509   // more than strlen(s) (s must contain a terminating null).
00510   // The string in d is aligned to the right and added with
00511   // spaces at the left, if necessary. The terminating null
00512   // IS NEITHER appended NOR copied to d.
00513   extern void strcpy_nr ( pstr d, cpstr s, int n );
00514 
00515   //   strcpy_ns(..) copies at most n symbols from string s to d,
00516   // but no more than strlen(s) (s must contain a terminating
00517   // null). The terminating null IS NEITHER appended NOR copied
00518   // to d; rather, d is padded with spaces up to the length of n
00519   // if strlen(s)<n.
00520   extern void strcpy_ns ( pstr d, cpstr s, int n );
00521 
00522   //   strcpy_cs(..) copies string s to string d cutting all
00523   // spaces at the end. Thus, " abcde   " will be copied
00524   // like " abcde" (terminating null appended).
00525   //   The function returns d.
00526   extern pstr strcpy_cs ( pstr d, cpstr s );
00527 
00528   //   strcpy_ncs(..) copies at most n characters from string s
00529   // to string d cutting all spaces at at the end. Thus, " abcde   "
00530   // will be copied like " abc" at n=4 and like " abcde" at n>5
00531   // (terminating null appended).
00532   //   The function returns d.
00533   extern pstr strcpy_ncs ( pstr d, cpstr s, int n );
00534 
00535   //   strcpy_css(..) copies string s to string d cutting all
00536   // spaces at the begining and at the end. Thus, " ab c de  "
00537   // will be copied like "ab c de" (terminating null appended).
00538   //   The function returns d.
00539   extern pstr strcpy_css ( pstr d, cpstr s );
00540 
00541   //   strcpy_ncss(..) copies at most n characters from string s
00542   // to string d cutting all spaces at the begining and at the end.
00543   // Thus, " ab c de  " will be copied like "ab" at n=3 (terminating
00544   // null appended).
00545   //   The function returns d.
00546   extern pstr strcpy_ncss ( pstr d, cpstr s, int n );
00547 
00548   //   strcpy_n0(..) copies at most n symbols from string s to d,
00549   // but no more than strlen(s) (s must contain a terminating
00550   // null). The terminating null IS appended to d.
00551   //   The function returns d.
00552   extern pstr strcpy_n0 ( pstr d, cpstr s, int n );
00553 
00554   //   strlen_des returns the length of a string as if all extra
00555   // spaces from the latter have been deleted. Extra spaces
00556   // include all leading and tracing spaces and any sequential
00557   // spaces when more than one. The string does not change.
00558   extern int strlen_des ( cpstr s );
00559 
00560   //   strcpy_des copies string s into string d removing all extra
00561   // spaces from the latter. Extra spaces include all leading and
00562   // tracing spaces and any sequential spaces when more than one.
00563   extern pstr strcpy_des ( pstr d, cpstr s );
00564 
00565   //   strcat_des appends string s to string d removing all extra
00566   // spaces from the latter. Extra spaces include all leading and
00567   // tracing spaces and any sequential spaces when more than one.
00568   extern pstr strcat_des ( pstr d, cpstr s );
00569 
00570   //  PadSpaces(..) pads string S with spaces making its length
00571   // equal to len. The terminating zero is added, so that S should
00572   // reserve space of a minimum len+1 characters.
00573   extern void PadSpaces ( pstr S, int len );
00574 
00575   enum SCUTKEY  {
00576     SCUTKEY_BEGIN  = 0x00000001,
00577     SCUTKEY_END    = 0x00000002,
00578     SCUTKEY_BEGEND = 0x00000003
00579   };
00580 
00581   //   CutSpaces(..) cuts spaces at the begining or end of
00582   // string S according to the value of CutKey. The function
00583   // returns S.
00584   extern pstr CutSpaces ( pstr S, int CutKey );
00585 
00586   //   DelSpaces(..) removes all spaces (or other symbols as
00587   // specified by 'c') from the string. The string is then
00588   // shrinked by the number of removed characters. Thus,
00589   // " as ttt  " becomes "asttt".
00590   extern pstr DelSpaces ( pstr S, char c=' ' );
00591 
00592   //   EnforceSpaces(..) replaces all unprintable characters,
00593   // except <CR>, <LF>, <TAB> and some others, for spaces
00594   extern pstr EnforceSpaces ( pstr S );
